author: gumb00
content:
Non-returning functions though have to be rolled out right away, we can't roll them out without bumping the version.

And if we have non-returning functions, we need to call them somehow - a special kind of call that ignores function's output values during stack validation, and that terminates section execution - and this is essentially JUMPF to non-returning

author: gumb00
content: (in current spec CALLF to non-returning is forbidden, and only JUMPF is allowed)

author: gumb00
content: Still I think if we decide to give up having non-returning flag for functions, we can make it work almost as JUMPF https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/issues/42

author: draganrakita
content: If the problem is how to empty the stack, should we introduce `POPN` opcode and make `POPN xffff` clear stack?

author: gumb00
content: Idea of POPN was floating around, but I guess with no strong support, because it didn't seem essential

author: gakonst
content: For EIP2537, should there also be a hash to 12-381 curve precompile?

author: big_tech_sux
content: i think we can actually just use special type in the code section to indicate that CALLF to this code section should behave like JUMPF

author: big_tech_sux
content: so, CALLF to non-returning function allowed
